original.name: Archeotheif
original.body: You may play this card at any time. Search the discard piles of the cosmic deck, reward deck (if present) and tech deck (if present) for any two cards. Gain those cards. Then, remove this card from the game.

original.name: Bona Fide Pioneer
original.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

Draw a space station card (ðŸ•®13), a moon card (ðŸ•®15), and a tech card (ðŸ•®9) (regardless of which variants are being used). Distribute them to players (including yourself) however you wish. Then, remove this card from the game.

original.name: Falce Facade
original.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

Replace your alien with another alien from your coalition. If you are using the Double Aliens variant, you may replace both aliens. Then, remove this card from the game.

original.name: Life Mulligan
original.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

Draw two alien sheets from the alien stack. Choose one and shuffle the other into the alien stack. Add the chosen alien to your coalition and replace your selected alien with it. Find its flare and include it as part of your opening hand. Then, remove this card from the game.

revised.name: Life Mulligan
revised.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

Draw two unused alien powers. Choose one and discard the other. Add the chosen alien to your coalition and replace your selected alien with it. Find its flare and include it as part of your starting hand. Then, remove this card from the game.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited for consistency.

original.name: Meritocrat
original.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

When you draw your opening hand, draw half of those cards (rounded up) from the reward deck, even if not using the Reward Deck variant (ðŸ•®10). If you draw any ultra reward cards, replace them with standard reward cards and shuffle the ultra reward cards into the reward deck. Then, remove this card from the game.

revised.name: Meritocrat
revised.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

When you draw your starting hand, draw half of those cards (rounded up) from the reward deck, even if not using the Reward Deck variant (ðŸ•®10). If you draw any ultra reward cards, replace them with standard reward cards and shuffle the ultra reward cards into the reward deck. Then, remove this card from the game.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited for consistency.

original.name: Obligatory Charity
original.body: You may play this card at any time. Choose a player. That player may choose to give you their hand. If they do not, draw eight cards from the deck. Then, remove this card from the game.

original.name: Secret Mission
original.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

Whether or not an Array Objectives variant is being used, use the Hidden Objectives variant (ðŸ•®19). Then, remove this card from the game.

revised.name: Secret Mission
revised.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

Use the Hidden Objectives variant (ðŸ•®19). Then, remove this card from the game.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited to remove the redundant array objectives reference.

original.name: Space Shark Wrangling
original.body: You may play this card during any regroup. Remove one of the following cards from the game: an evolution card, a hazard card, a moon (and card), a station (and card), a revealed objective, or a tech. Any ships on these cards are returned to their owner's colonies. Then, remove this card from the game.

revised.name: Space Shark Wrangling
revised.body: You may play this card during any regroup. Remove one of the following from the game: an evolution card, a hazard card, a moon (and card), a station (and card), a revealed objective, or a tech. Any ships on these cards are returned to their owner's colonies. Then, remove this card from the game.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited for clarity.

original.name: Unilateral Banishment
original.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

Cross out one alien in another player's coalition if it has at least two aliens. If that player had selected the crossed-out alien, they must select another alien from their coalition. Then, remove this card from the game.

original.name: Unlimited Power
original.body: You may play this card at the same timing as your alien power to use your alien power even if it was zapped, is limited to once per encounter, or is facedown. This use of your power cannot be zapped. Then, remove this card from the game.

original.name: Unrefusable Offer
original.body:
You may play this card immediately or remove it from the game.

Permanently swap an unselected alien in your coalition with an unselected alien in another player's coalition. Then, remove this card from the game.
